result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Esther R. Whatley

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on December 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:59 PM Defendant Esther R. Whatley appeared by video.  Attorney Brian David Van Ells in court for Esther R. Whatley.  Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for State of Wisconsin.  Inducement made but needs time to discuss it with his client.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch  for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Offer deadline is set for August 26, 2022.  
Minutes.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:10 am.
Scheduling conference on October 5, 2022 at 11:10 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:23 pm - Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Esther R. Whatley in court.  Attorney Brian David Van Ells in court for Esther R. Whatley. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Brian Van Ells, through public defender.

2:14 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Esther R. Whatley not in court. Attorney Carl Knepel appearing for the defendant.  PD's office has an attorney that will take the case, but cannot appear with the defendant until July. Initial appearance is adjourned to 07-11-22 at 1:30 pm. Br. 1.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct and 2 cts. felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-27-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no assaultive contact with D.M.B.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 06-10-2022
